info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued March 23 at 3:59AM ChST until March 25 at 4:00PM ChST by NWS Tiyan GU
info.description:
* WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 9 to 14 feet in the surf zone. For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents. For the Coastal Flood Statement, isolated minor coastal flooding expected.
* WHERE...North and east facing reefs of the Marianas.
* WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory and High Rip Current Risk, until 4 PM Monday. For the Coastal Flood Statement, from 7 AM this morning through Monday afternoon.
* IMPACTS...Some water on low lying roads and property. Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A significant northerly swell generated by a distant low pressure system off the coast of Japan is expected to bring hazardous surf to north facing reefs of the Marianas. A nomogram analysis from a scatterometry pass during the onset of the northerly swell off the east coast of Japan a few cycles ago, in addition to recent model guidance trends, indicate that there is still potential for dangerous surf of 15 feet and above tonight or Sunday along north and/or east facing reefs. If conditions warrant, a High Surf Warning may be issued this afternoon. Due to already high tides, minor coastal inundation of up to 1 foot is possible Sunday through Monday afternoon along north shores.
info.instruction:
Do not drive through flooded roadways.
Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions.
Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don't swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.

parameter.value: HIGH SURF ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM MONDAY... ...HIGH RISK OF RIP CURRENTS THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON... ...COASTAL FLOOD STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM THIS MORNING THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON
